rationale: No intensifier or comparative directly modifies a risk-adjective.
The segment provides factual statistics without using high-potency verbs or metaphors.
The segment uses a plain verb ('recorded') with a scale ('over 700 cases globally since November 2003'), but plain outcome verbs are excluded from Q3 unless other cues fire.
The segment reports global human cases since 2003 but contains no explicit calming language.
No minimiser ('only', 'just', 'merely', 'a single', 'few') combined with an explicit scale contrast.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
The segment reports number of human cases globally, not capabilities or preparedness.
Reports the numerical metric of human cases ('over 700 cases... have been recorded') using a standard verb.
